attributes.action: Extend Oyster card fares on all London to Brighton rail routes
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Londoners want out. Brightonians want in. Two of the coolest cities in England are separated by a mere hour’s train journey, yet a round trip is going to set you back a massive £26!

Travelling from Zone 6 – the outskirts of London – to London Bridge Station – a potentially longer journey – costs from just £6.50 return. For that you can also travel all over London to your heart’s content at off-peak times. In real terms that’s slightly more than the price of a packet of cigarettes. And slightly less than a brand new bucket and spade. Madness, we say!

We want to visit the seaside. We want to fish for Oysters with our Oyster cards. And we want our friends by the sea to see the South Bank. It’s only fair. 

So sign up! And help us join these two fair cities with the mighty BLOyster.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with the GLA.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
